name: Proparacaine hydrochloride
indications: proparacaine hydrochloride ophthalmic solution indicated topical anesthesia ophthalmic practice . representative ophthalmic procedures preparation provides good local anesthesia include measurement intraocular pressure ( tonometry ) , removal foreign bodies sutures cornea , conjunctival scraping diagnosis gonioscopic examination ; also indicated topical anesthetic prior surgical operations cataract extraction .
contraindications: deep anesthesia cataract extraction : instill 1 drop every 5 10 minutes 5 7 doses . removal sutures : instill 1 2 drops 2 3 minutes removal stitches . removal foreign bodies : instill 1 2 drops prior operating . tonometry : instill 1 2 drops immediately measurement
warningsAndPrecautions: proparacaine hydrochloride ophthalmic solution usp , 0.5 % supplied low density polyethylene white bottle natural dropper tip white screw cap following size : ndc 70756-193-35 15 ml bottle carton . storage : refrigerate 2°c 8° c ( 36°f 46°f ) . keep bottle tightly closed . store bottles carton empty protect light . solution shows faint yellow color , used . tamper-evident seal broken missing . keep reach children . manufactured : lifestar pharma llc 1200 macarthur blvd . mahwah , nj 07430 usa product switzerland revised : july 2024 , v-02
adverseReactions: preparation contraindicated patients known hypersensitivity component solution .
indications_original: Proparacaine hydrochloride ophthalmic solution is indicated for topical anesthesia in ophthalmic practice. Representative ophthalmic procedures in which the preparation provides good local anesthesia include measurement of intraocular pressure (tonometry), removal of foreign bodies and sutures from the cornea, conjunctival scraping in diagnosis and gonioscopic examination; it is also indicated for use as a topical anesthetic prior to surgical operations such as cataract extraction.
contraindications_original:
Deep anesthesia as in cataract extraction:
                  
                  Instill 1 drop every 5 to 10 minutes for 5 to 7 doses.
                  
                     Removal of sutures:
                  
                  Instill 1 or 2 drops 2 or 3 minutes before removal of stitches.
                  
                     Removal of foreign bodies:
                  
                  Instill 1 or 2 drops prior to operating.
                  
                     Tonometry:
                  
                  Instill 1 or 2 drops immediately before measurement
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Proparacaine hydrochloride ophthalmic solution USP, 0.5% is supplied in a low density polyethylene white bottle with a natural dropper tip with a white screw cap in the following size: 
                  NDC 70756-193-35 15 mL bottle in carton.
                  
                     Storage:
                  
                     Refrigerate at 2°C to 8° C (36°F to 46°F). Keep bottle tightly closed. Store bottles in carton until empty to protect from light. If solution shows more than a faint yellow color, it should not be used.
                  
                     DO NOT USE IF TAMPER-EVIDENT SEAL IS BROKEN OR MISSING.
                  
                  
                     Keep out of reach of children.
                  
                  Manufactured for:
                  
                     Lifestar Pharma LLC 
                  1200 MacArthur Blvd.
                  Mahwah, NJ 07430 USA 
                  
                     Product of Switzerland
                  
                  Revised: July 2024, V-02
adverseReactions_original: This preparation is contraindicated in patients with known hypersensitivity to any component of the solution.
